predicate.note: Frames file for 'disassociate' based on sentences in wsj. No Verbnet entry, but 'dissociate' (which means about the same thing) is in 23.1. This frames file is imported almost directly from dissociate.

roleset.name: un-associate

example.name: oddly ergative
example.text: When an electric current is applied to the palladium and platinum electrodes, the heavy water did begin [*-3] to break up, or disassociate.

example.name: transitive
example.text: It would go along [*-2] doing nothing but [*-3] disassociating the heavy water and then at totally unpredictable times, it would begin producing excess heat for as long as 10 or 11 hours before quieting down.

example.name: actually from disassociate
example.text: ``The market is beginning [*-1] to disassociate itself from Wall Street,'' said one New York trader.

roleset.note: The first two usages seem to be specialized and mean something like 'fall apart'.
